Definition: The percentage of times an ad was clicked relative to how many times it was shown (impressions).
The percentage of leads with whom the agent or sales team successfully makes contact,.
The percentage of consumers who clicked on an ad and successfully completed the form to become a lead. The "floor" for this metric is typically expected to be around 50%.

Calculation Method: Total Spend / Total Sales (e.g., $32,876 spend / 40 sales = ~$821 CPA).
Definition: The specific cost incurred to generate a single sale or write a household. This is described as the "number one metric" and "end-all-be-all" for measuring success, as opposed to vanity metrics like CPL.
The amount paid for each individual click on an ad unit. This serves as the "entry point" cost before a lead is generated.

Calculation Method: Total Spend / Total Number of Policy Items Sold,
Definition: The cost to acquire a specific policy "item" (e.g., an auto policy vs. a home policy) within a household.

Calculation Method: Total Spend / Total Leads (Alternatively: CPC / Click-to-Lead Conversion Rate).
Definition: The average cost to generate one lead. It is frequently referred to as a "vanity metric" because a low CPL does not guarantee profitability if the leads do not convert to sales.
The percentage of leads that result in the consumer clicking to call the agency directly. The average is typically around 10%.

Calculation Method: [Annual Revenue x Gross Margin x Expected Duration] / Acquisition Cost
Definition: The total revenue a business can expect from a single customer account over the life of the relationship.
The percentage of leads that result in the agent providing a price quote,.
The percentage of quoted prospects that ultimately purchase a policy.

Calculation Method: Total Premium Generated / Total Ad Spend (Goal ideal is 5:1),
Definition: A metric used to measure the gross revenue generated for every dollar spent on advertising.
The percentage of clicks that result in a sale. This is sometimes used in high-level dashboard analysis to measure funnel efficiency from the very top.
The percentage of generated leads that result in a sold policy or bound household,.
